Sketch on face 1: Create a loop with four lines. - Line 1: Start point [0.0, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start point [0.75, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.075] - Line 3: Start point [0.75, 0.075], end point [0.0, 0.075] - Line 4: Start point [0.0, 0.075], end point [0.0, 0.0] Sketch on face 2: Create a loop with four lines. This loop shares the same vertices as the loop on face 1. Extrusion: Extrude the sketch by 0.2063 units in the positive normal direction and 0 units in the negative normal direction with a sketch scale of 0.75. This will create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Part 2: A CAD model of a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom Create a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0562, 0.0, 0.0187]. Sketch on face 1: Create a loop with one circle. - Circle 1: Center [0.0187, 0.0188], radius 0.0188 Sketch on face 2: Create a loop with one circle. - Circle 1: Center [0.3938, 0.0188], radius 0.0188 Sketch on face 3: Create a loop with one circle. - Circle 1: Center [0.6188, 0.0188], radius 0.0188 Extrusion: Extrude the sketches by 0 units in the positive normal direction and 0.2063 units in the negative normal direction with a sketch scale of 0.6375 and a cut operation. This will create three cylindrical objects with a flat top and bottom, positioned at different angles and heights. The final shape is a rectangular prism with rounded corners and edges, and three visible holes along its length. The rounded corners and edges can be achieved by applying a fillet operation to the appropriate edges. The exact dimensions can be obtained from the "length", "width", and "height" values provided in the description of each part and the final shape.</description>
